verses.verse: (1 Kings 4.32; Eccl 12.9) The proverbs of Solomon son of David, king of Israel:
Prologue For learning about wisdom and instruction, for understanding words of insight,
(Prov 2.9; 19.20) for gaining instruction in wise dealing, righteousness, justice, and equity;
(Prov 2.10, 11; 8.5, 12) to teach shrewdness to the simple, knowledge and prudence to the young—
(Prov 9.9; 14.6) let the wise, too, hear and gain in learning and the discerning acquire skill,
to understand a proverb and a figure, the words of the wise and their riddles.
(Job 28.28; Ps 111.10; Eccl 12.13) The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge; fools despise wisdom and instruction.
Warnings against Evil Companions (Prov 4.1; 6.20) Hear, my child, your father’s instruction, and do not reject your mother’s teaching,
(Gen 41.42; Prov 4.9) for they are a fair garland for your head and pendants for your neck.
(Deut 13.8; Eph 5.11) My child, if sinners entice you, do not consent.
(v 18|PRO 1:18; Prov 12.6) If they say, “Come with us, let us lie in wait for blood; let us wantonly ambush the innocent;
(Ps 28.1; 124.3) like Sheol let us swallow them alive and whole, like those who go down to the Pit.
We shall find all kinds of costly things; we shall fill our houses with spoil.
Throw in your lot among us; we will all have one purse”—
(Ps 1.1; 119.101) my child, do not walk in their way; keep your foot from their paths,
(Isa 59.7) for their feet run to evil, and they hurry to shed blood.
For in vain is the net baited while the bird is looking on;
yet they lie in wait—to kill themselves! and set an ambush—for their own lives!
(Prov 15.27) Such is the end (Gk: Heb are the ways) of all who are greedy for gain; it takes away the life of its possessors.
The Call of Wisdom (Prov 8.1) Wisdom cries out in the street; in the squares she raises her voice.
At the busiest corner she cries out; at the entrance of the city gates she speaks:
(vv 4, 29, 32|PRO 1:42932; Ps 1.1) “How long, O simple ones, will you love being simple? How long will scoffers delight in their scoffing and fools hate knowledge?
(Joel 2.28) Give heed to my reproof; I will pour out my thoughts to you; I will make my words known to you.
(Isa 65.12; Zech 7.11; Rom 10.21) Because I have called and you refused, have stretched out my hand and no one heeded,
(Ps 107.11; Prov 15.10; Lk 7.30) and because you have ignored all my counsel and would have none of my reproof,
(Ps 2.4; Prov 6.15; 10.24) I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when panic strikes you,
when panic strikes you like a storm and your calamity comes like a whirlwind, when distress and anguish come upon you.
(Isa 1.15; Ezek 8.18; Mic 3.4; Zech 7.13) Then they will call upon me, but I will not answer; they will seek me diligently but will not find me.
Because they hated knowledge and did not choose the fear of the LORD,
(Ps 81.11) would have none of my counsel and despised all my reproof,
(Job 4.8; Prov 14.14; Isa 3.11; Jer 6.19) therefore they shall eat the fruit of their way and be sated with their own devices.
(Jer 2.19) For waywardness kills the simple, and the complacency of fools destroys them;
(Ps 25.12) but those who listen to me will be secure and will live at ease without dread of disaster.”
